message.content:
Reinforcement Learning, Neural Networks. 

Reinforcement learning is the main focus of the paper, as the modified Platt's resource-allocation network (RAN) is designed for a reinforcement-learning paradigm. The Q-learning network used to solve the inverted pendulum problem is also a type of reinforcement learning. 

Neural networks are also relevant, as the modified RAN uses hidden units that continue to learn via back-propagation after being restarted. The Q-learning network is also a type of neural network.
